meanings.definition: A person or thing that breaks something.
meanings.sent1: The little boy was a real buster when it came to his toys.
meanings.sent2: The hammer was the buster that shattered the glass.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy turned into a buster, breaking all the flower pots.
meanings.sent4: The storm was a buster, shattering windows and uprooting trees.
meanings.sent5: The wrecking ball swung like a buster, demolishing the old building.

meanings.definition: A person who is very successful or skillful at a particular activity.
meanings.sent1: She was a real buster in the art of baking delicious cakes.
meanings.sent2: The athlete was a buster on the track, winning every race.
meanings.sent3: The young musician became a buster, playing the guitar like a pro.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a buster, leading her to success in every competition.
meanings.sent5: His creativity was a buster, producing amazing artworks that amazed everyone.

meanings.definition: A film or television program that is very successful or popular.
meanings.sent1: The action movie was a real buster at the box office.
meanings.sent2: The comedy show became a buster, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The animated film was a buster, captivating audiences of all ages.
meanings.sent4: The thriller series was a buster, keeping viewers on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent5: The documentary was a buster, shedding light on an important issue.
